page.title: 18Wouldham
page.content:
All Saint's Church Wouldham is built on the site of earlier churches. Parts of it go back to 935.The tower was built between 1470 and 1530.
In the Church yard there is the grave of Walter Burke who was Purser on the "Victory", Nelson's ship at the Battle of Trafalgar. He was awarded Â£280 prizemoney and bought a farm and a house at Wouldham. He lived in Wouldham for ten years and died, aged 70, on 12th September 1815. For about 100 years the children of Wouldham School have put flowers on his grave on Trafalgar Day 21st October.
Burke's cottage Pursers House has been moved to Maresfield, Sussex and rebuilt in its original form.
